text: Cramped. EMILY CALE (10) slumbers. A stack of magazines b her bed. US Weekly. Teen People. The Economist. We hear a cell phone BOOP. Emily stirs. Checks her batter first gen iPhone. An email notification. The screen reads President's Treaty With Iran Draws Criticism at G8 Summit. Emily goes to the CNN app. Pulls the covers over her head A kid sneaking TV, except in this case, it's not cartoons it's Wolf Blitzer:

...The proposed treaty with the newly elected moderate President of Iran, Mehrak Al-Said, is drawing huge criticism for the Sawyer administration. The President was booed when he took the stage to speak in Geneva over the weekend... Drowned out by a LOW RUMBLING. Windows rattling. Emily's bed begins SHAKING. Earthquake? Emily leaps up, huge smil on her face. Throws the window open and looks up to see A COLUMN OF HELICOPTERS thundering overhead! Three dark green VH-3D Sea King choppers, each with United States of America emblazoned on the side...
Leads the Presidential Motorcade of the sky. Emily looks in wonder as Marine One and her two thundering companions bank East towards the dawn...
The cabin holds ten. Nine men in suits. One woman in the front jump seat. Secret Service AGENT CAROL FINNERTY (30' Smart pant suit, gun on her hip. She keys her wrist mic:
Castle, this is Hummingbird, we are inbound from Andy, three minutes out--
Carol? Finnerty looks up to see Agent BRIAN GRIGGS across from h
He wants to do the thing. Finnerty sighs.
Really?
Really.

Mr. President, it's not a good idea to deviate from the flight plan... She's now looking into the smiling face of PRESIDENT JAME SAWYER, the 46th Chief Executive of the United States. Handsome, 40's, African-American.
Come on, Carol, pretty please? Leader of the free world here, saying 'pretty please' here. Oughta count for something. A beat. Finnerty keys her radio mic.
Captain Joffrey, this is Agent Finnerty? The President would like to do the thing. The others grin as the helicopter banks left...

Beautifully illuminated. A JOGGER and his dog, huffing an puffing by when MARINE ONE sweeps in low overhead, coming down 23rd Stree The two escort choppers playing follow-the-leader behind circling the Memorial, saying hello to Mr. Lincoln. The column of choppers turns East, flying out over the reflecting pool! An air tour of the sights...

President Sawyer smiles in his seat as he watches Lincoln recede. As they make a wide arc around the Washington Monument, their destination comes into view -- THE WHITE HOUSE. All lit up. Spectacular.
Be it ever so humble...
(into wrist walkie) Castle, this is Hummingbird, we are one minute out, I need a go/no go.

A structure on the North side of the White House Grounds, Pennsylvania Avenue. Inside, packed with electronics. The GUARD sits hunched over a monitor system that shows d of traffic camera feeds from the streets around the compl
Hummingbird, this is Castle Ground, you are clear.
Low lit. Two dress MARINES sit in the outer office. A NAV RADAR TECH watches his screen sweep for nearby air traffi
Hummingbird, this is Castle Sky, you are clear.
High atop the famous columned central building, a black c SNIPER TEAM scans the night sky with their rifle-scopes, checking surrounding buildings for movement.

Hummingbird, this is Castle Keep, you are- Hold. THROUGH HIS NIGHTSCOPE - We see movement on the eighth fl balcony of a building a half mile away. He frowns. Enhanc magnification. The suspicious behavior comes into focus.. A couple having sex on their balcony. The Lead Sniper gri

Hummingbird, this is Castle Keep, you are clear. The column of helicopters swoops in, circling the South L The Lead Chopper pulls a slow turn, coming in for a landi A pair of MARINES in dress blues come out to meet it. The door does not open. The Chopper sits there for a good twenty seconds as the snipers continue to scan. Then:
(through radio) Castle Keep?
Nothing.
(through radio) All right, Decoy up, Marine One in. The chopper on the ground rises up and the second helicop the real Marine One - swoops in for a landing on
The MARINES open the door and President Sawyer steps off bird, flanked by Finnerty, Dawson, and aides. Sawyer snap the Marines a salute as they head for the White House.
It's really not a bad way to travel, is it?
It beats Dupont Circle, sir.
When's my wife back?
Not until tonight.
I'm gonna get some shut-eye. Wake me if we need to attack anything. In front of him, more Marines hold open the door to the W colonnade. As the President passes them, walking inside:
Welcome home, sir. Finnerty looks back at Marine One as it lifts off the Sou Lawn. An incredible sight. Griggs smiles next to her.
Tell me we don't have the best job in the world.

Two other Secret Service Agents stand a very different de Guarding a broken down row house in Georgetown. The first is handsome, close cropped hair. This is JOHN CALE (30's) A HORRIBLE COUGHING comes from inside. Wheezy and phlegmy like a grown man trying to hack up a furball.
Oh, God... The coughing resumes. Awful. The agents wince. Then:
Is there any kleenex out there?
Clutching a box of kleenex, Cale raps on the bathroom doo It opens and ELI RAPHELSON (70) sticks his head out. Clad in a ratty bathrobe, still wheezing.
Thank you, John. When I'm done in here, I'll make you some coffee.
I'm fine, Mr. Speaker-
I insist.
Raphelson stands at the stove, mixing what looks to be th world's worst cup of instant coffee. A TV tuned to CNN replays the President's Geneva Speech:

(on TV) ...-There are those who will say we are foolish, those who treat every opportunity for peace as a show of weakness. To them I say I have found a friend in President Al-Said. And together, we will prove that the pen truly is mightier than the sword. Applause mixed with boos. Raphelson adds way too much cre to the coffee. Looks to Cale.
What do you think of all this?
I don't know, sir. It's good to have less enemies.
All he's doing is legitimizing them. Geopolitics is chess, not checkers; you have to see the whole board. The President is very naive sometimes.
Why didn't you run against him?
Because that is the one job I never wanted. I like my constituents, I like being a thorn in the side of the administration. Not all of us are looking to move up. (MORE )
(casual) You have your interview today? Cale looks at him, surprised.
I know you want to be on the President's detail. Are you not pleased with your life of excitement and adventure here?
Sir, I- I appreciate everything you've done for me, but-

It's all right, son. It's good to have ambition. I'll be sorry to see you go is all. This may not be the White House, but there's coffee. He slides a mug over to Cale. Cale takes a sip. Awful. Hides it well. He likes the old guy. Raphelson nods, happ
I'm gonna get a shower.
Now in a suit, Raphelson climbs behind the wheel of his battered Toyota Camry and fires it up. Cale slides into t SUV idling behind him - the follow car. Into his wrist:

Pinball is rolling, we are enroute to Punchbowl. As they roll out after Raphelson, we pan around to see th destination in the distance, what "Punchbowl" really is THE U.S. CAPITOL DOME. Silhouetted against the rising sun

McLean, Virginia. An alarm clocks wails. The lone figure wakes. This is MARTIN BISHOP (late 50's). Fit, trim. He sits a moment. Alone in a house for two. Then rises. A SERIES OF QUICK CUTS - Bishop showers, shaves. Pulls on pants, a button down shirt. Selects a tie. Withdraws a GLOCK. Checks the load. Straps it into his shoulder holst  A small silver cross hangs from his mirror. He takes it. Slips it around his neck. Looks at himself. He stands there for a long time. Bishop takes the cross off. Hangs it back on the mirror. Pulls on his suit coat and is out the door.

Cale and Dunleavy shadow a briskly walking Raphelson as h climbs the famous steps. Cale, scanning passersby for any sign of potential threat. Everything okay until he spies A long haired FIDGETY GUY. He keeps scratching his beard and eyeing the Speaker. Cale, about to say something when the Fidgety Guy suddenly reaches into his coat and -- TIME SLOWS DOWN. Cale pivots to block Raphelson, his own hand drifts to the holster on his hip, about to pull, but Fidgety Guy's faster and his gun hand emerges brandishing A banana. Fidgety Guy's breakfast. Cale exhales.
You okay there, Tex? Too much coffee? Cale doesn't respond. They head up the steps and inside.
Raphelson walks the halls, saying hello to various Congre as they arrive for work. Stepping into a big office where AGENTS KELLERMAN and BRIGHT stands guard. Cale steps up.
He watched Jeopardy, went to bed to at 8:00, got up to pee twice, and is still having that allergy thing. We need to start keeping kleenex in the downstairs bathroom. He's all yours.
I'll try not to die of excitement. Cale smiles. Heads down the hall to an even bigger office
Hustle and bustle. An assistant sits at the front desk, rolling calls. JENNA (30's), sweet and flirty.
Office of the Vice President. Hold please. She sees Cale and flashes him her best smile.
Did you get them?
What do I get if I did?
What do you want?
Dinner, candlelight, and a sincere promise that you'll try to get to second base.
Done. She hands him an envelope and a card with her phone numbe on it. Cale looks inside the envelope.
She's gonna love these, Jenna. Thanks! He kisses her on the cheek and is out the door...

Emily sits at the kitchen table, sullenly picking at her cereal. Her mother MELANIE (30's, hard), mixes vodka from the freezer in with her morning OJ. The former Mrs. Cale. A knock on the door. Melanie opens it. Cale.
You're late. She thought you weren't coming.

Of course I was coming. Emily, get your stuff. Emily grabs her bag and heads out the door. As she passes Cale he tries to kiss her on the forehead, but she dodges Melanie smiles at this. A small victory for her side.  10.
You missed her talent show.
When was her talent show?
Thursday.
What did she do?
She was a flag twirler.
That's a talent?
She practiced for like six weeks and her own father can't be bothered to show up...
Emily, sitting in the car, listening to her parents fight Old news. She slips on her headphones...
Cale nods to the vodka bottle.
Getting an early start, I see.
Why not? It's my day off. Cale has a retort, but swallows it. Instead:
Listen, I wanted to talk about custody-
I'm sure you do. That way you don't have to cut me that check every month-
You really think this is about the checks, Mel?  11. He stares at her drink. She shifts her weight from one fo to the other, then shakes her head and chuckles.
Jesus, John. She doesn't even like you. That lands. Hard.
You have a good day.
Cale gets into the driver's seat. Emily listening to musi checking the Drudge Report on her phone. Cale looks at he
You pissed at me? She doesn't even look up at him. Hell hath no fury.
You gonna be on that thing all day? She's texting now. After a moment, Cale's own phone chime He checks it. Text from Emily - Yes.
I'm so glad I got you that phone. (sighs) Well, I guess you won't be wanting these then... He puts the envelope from Jenna on the dash. A beat.
Lame.
You don't even know what it is.
Do you really think that's going to work? We're both adults here, John.
Speak for yourself. Open the envelope.
What is it?  12.
A pony. Just open it. Dubious, Emily opens the envelope. Her face lights up.
Are you serious? I didn't think they even gave White House tours anymore!

They don't. It's a six month waiting list unless you know people. I thought a budding policy wonk like you might want to see where the most powerful man in the world lives. She looks up at him. Genuinely happy.
This is really cool, John.
(starting the car) We're really sticking with the John thing, huh? As Emily nods, they pull out into traffic...
Cale drives as Emily surfs her phone.
Listen, when we get there I have to go to a quick meeting, okay? Then we can go on the tour.
(reading off her phone) Did you know that 1.5 million people visit the White House every year?
I did not.
That works out to about 5000 people a day.
Fascinating. (MORE )
(pause) I'm sorry I missed your talent show.
I'm not. Did you know the White House was originally called the Presidential Palace?
I'm serious. I wish I'd been there.
No you, don't. All I did was twirl a flag, it was stupid. Cale looks at her.
You don't have to do that, you know.
What?
Have a thick skin. You're ten. Emily doesn't respond. A beat.
Did you really think I wasn't coming? But Emily's not looking at him, she's looking at...
Oh, wow... THE WHITE HOUSE. Approaching from the South Side, with th fountain blasting. Enough to take Emily's breath away. Cale smiles at her reaction, driving up to
Cale pulls up to the massive guard gate. The Officer in Charge leans out of the structure.
Morning folks! Gonna need some photo

Cale hands it over. Instantly two other guards appear fro nowhere, each holding long mirrors at the end of poles.  14. They sweep the bottom of the car for explosives. One guard checks the trunk while the other roots through back seat. Emily takes a picture of him with her phone.
What are you guys looking for?
Explosives.
This is awesome.
(handing ID's back) Park up on the left and you're going to the East Lobby. Have a good one. Cale drives on.
Cale pulls to a halt next to a parked SOUNDTEK van. A HUG MAN with a SHAVED HEAD is pulling a large speaker box out the back onto a dolly. Cale, watching him...
Did you know the President travels in an eight ton military armored modified Cadillac CTS, built to withstand gas, chemical, and missile attacks?
That's on the internet?
Wikipedia. You guys are doing a bang-up job with the secrecy thing.

Honey wood panelling. A GUARD DESK to the right, by set o metal detectors. Beyond, two more security checkpoints. X ray, body scan, bag search, facial rec. Serious stuff. On the walls hang Presidential Portraits. Roosevelt. Eisenhower. They lived here. Emily stares at them as Cale loads their stuff into the x-ray machine.  15.

Welcome to the White House! We're going to take you through three levels of security today. First, I'm going to need to empty your pockets - all metal objects in the tray please. Cell phones and cameras are permitted on the premises, but need to be examined by the agents first! OVERALLED WORKMEN lay tools on the x-ray belt. Photo ID's checked against internet records. Cale, to the officer:
I'm Secret Service, off duty, I'm carrying.

You're going to have to check your weapon, sir. The officer produces a LOCKBOX. Cale unholsters his Glock and places it inside. The officer locks it and hands it t an AGENT. As Cale and Emily continue through security... CAMERA FOLLOWS the Agent carrying the lockbox, as he take it down into the bowels of the White House. Down a
Concrete stairs, dimly lit. Past another agent into
A dark carpeted hallway. Down the corridor, round a corne
A WEAPONS CAGE. The Armory Master looks up briefly as the Agent logs in Cale's lockbox. Pan off this to the countle ASSAULT RIFLES and SHOTGUNS locked behind steel mesh...
Cale and Emily sit, waiting. Awkward silence again. Emily on her phone, surfing. After a beat:
How's school?
School blows.  16.
I'm glad we can have these talks. The outer office door opens and Finnerty enters.
(whispering to Emily) Do me a favor, for the next twenty seconds pretend you don't hate me.
John Cale? I'm Carol Finnerty, I run the President's detail.
(vising) This is my daughter Emily.
My father is a very special man.
That's... good to know. If you'll follow me?
Finnerty settles in behind her desk as Cale takes a seat.
You often bring small children to job interviews?
Diversionary tactic. While I'm in here, she's out there stealing everything that's not nailed down. (no response) Sorry, that was a joke.
All evidence to the contrary.
Sorry?
Mr. Cale, I'm going on seventeen hours of no sleep, so let's just get through this, okay? She opens the file sitting in front of her and reads.  She looks 17.

John Cale, born 1983, Columbus, Ohio, public school, track and field, and then one single solitary semester at San Diego State University. Married your childhood sweetheart five months later, bounced from job to job. Mechanic, limo driver, construction-
Is my credit score in there too?
Yes, and you should be ashamed of yourself. You finally landed in the Army Reserve. Enlisted for the bonus.
Is that a crime?

We tend to prefer God and Country to "in it for the paycheck". Did two tours in Afghanistan, was wounded in the Kunar Province, received the Purple Heart. A Lance Corporal Brian Dawson put you up for a Silver Star, but you did not receive it.
It's an honor just to be nominated.
You pulled Corporal Dawson from a burning Humvee. Why?
I was somewhat concerned he was getting too warm in there. at him.
It's funny to me that you think glib is the way to go here.
There was an IED attack, the Humvee flipped, and we were taking fire. Everyone else bolted, I grabbed him.  18.
Why?
Because we don't leave men behind. (pause) And he owed me money.
Corporal Dawson happens to be the nephew of the Speaker of the House. And when you were discharged from the Army, the Speaker urged you to go into the Secret Service.
He was kind enough to recommend me for a job.
You're on the Speaker's detail now. He did you a favor.
You could say that.
I did. Why do you want to be on the President's detail?
Nothing against the Speaker, but no one's ever going to take a shot at him. This is the big leagues. She studies him.
Look, I appreciate your service, but this is clearly the record of a man who's slid by mostly on looks, charm, and favors-
Mostly on the looks, actually-
-And as you say, this is the big leagues.  19.
I know I've bounced around, but this is something I can do. Giving yourself up for something greater than you... that's what I need.
I'm sorry, but the Secret Service is not somewhere to find yourself. Thanks for coming in. She rises and offers her hand. Cale blinks. Surprised it' over. Rises too. Shakes and turns to the door.
Emily looks up as Cale emerges.
How'd it go? Cale's face says it all...
Finnerty strides through the lobby, passing the Photo Off and Homeland Security. Keycards through another door into

The on-site security hub of the White House. 40 odd agents, some in uniform, some in suit and tie, sta drinking coffee, talking with each other. Shift change co up, but before that, the morning briefing. Finnerty slides into the back of the room as MARTIN BISHO walks to the front. Head of the Secret Service. The Boss.
All right, listen up. First and most importantly, who owes me money on the Wizards? Grumbling throughout the agents, some come forward and ha him cash.
That's right. Thank you. I hope you've all learned a valuable lesson here. Okay, light day. (MORE )

Eagle is not leaving the Castle. Phone calls with the leadership staring at nine, photo spray with the Duke women's lacrosse team at noon, lunch with the Vice President, and then the First Lady is back tonight. Ted? AGENT TED HOPE (40's), prematurely balding speaks up.
Empress is wheels down at 18:45. They're supposed to have dinner of the residence but... He spreads his hands - "You know how they are".
Assuming they call an audible on going out, we need to have advance on Dino, Obelisk, and Marcel's.
What if she wants sushi? From the back of the room, Finnerty speaks up:
No, she's off sushi, she had that thing on the Japan trip.
Jesus, Carol, how are you still awake?
Five Hour Energy Drink and patriotism, sir.
You have a Threat Matrix for us?
Homeland says a guy they were sitting on in Toronto went missing 36 hours ago, they think he might have crossed.
This guy a lone nut or well financed horseman of the apocalypse?  21.
College student with a blog, thinks the WTO caused 9/11.
He's onto us. Okay, distribute the photo. Visitors today?
We have Representatives Fiske, Holden, Rafferty, and Senators Simon and Truesdale coming in for a budget meeting at 15:00, plus Soundtek is here again today.
Soundtek?
AV guys, they're replacing the surround system in the movie theater. Eagle wants it ready for football on Sunday. From all accounts, they are teeth rattlingly loud.
The First Lady should be thrilled.
All right, that's game. Grab an Order of the Day and let's get to work. The Agents grab top-sheets from a stack by the coffee. As they file out Finnerty approaches Bishop.
For the love of all that is holy, go get some sleep.
I'm going. (as he watches the Agents file out) You know you're going to miss this.
I'm not, actually.
I can tell when you're lying, you know. We're gonna miss you, too.  22. Bishop smiles at her. A little sad.
All that time in Switzerland, it would have killed you to bring Muriel back a cuckoo clock?
On your desk. (she turns to go) Twenty bucks says they pick Marcel's tonight.
I wouldn't bet against you. Bishop, watching her go. Something eating at him...
Cale and Emily stand with a tour group of ten. At the fro stands DONNIE THE TOUR GUIDE (40's). Way too chipper.

I'm Donnie and I'm going to be your guide today as we take a walk through American History! First I want to give you a big Washington DC welcome to the White House, where we get millions of guests a year from all corners of the globe! (to Cale) Where are you folks from?
Washington DC.
Okay, bad choice. (to a Fat Woman) How about you, ma'am?
I'm from North Carolina.
And what brings you to the White House today?
I wanna see the tunnels where JFK snuck Marilyn Monroe in.  23.
Unfortunately, those don't exist. (the Fat Woman is crestfallen) But we do have some other really exciting sights to show you! If you'll follow me?
A beautiful solarium with a corner windows looking out on the South Lawn of the White House. Bright and sunny. As Donnie talks he leads them through.
Does anyone want to guess how old the White House is? (sees Emily raising her hand) Young lady?
221 years old.

That's... very accurate. Construction was begun in 1792 on what was then called the President's House. Article One, Section Eight of the US Constitution set forth that a district of not more than ten miles square should house the new seat of government. Does anyone know why?
So no one state could claim the President's House.

Right again. The founders were crafty. They figured if the President lived in one state then he would be beholden to that state above all others. But if he lived in a district separate from all of them, then he and his government could serve all the United States equally and fairly. In many ways, the entire city of Washington, the whole District of Columbia, was built from the ground up in order to hold this one house.  24. As they step into
A long white corridor with a red brick floor wall of wind looking out to the South Lawn.

The White House is actually three buildings; the East Wing, where you came in, the West Wing, which houses the Oval and Executive offices of the President, and the Residence, which is the big famous building in the center. These three buildings are connected by two long hallways called colonnades; we're in the East Colonnade right now. The colonnades were originally built by Thomas Jefferson to house horses, but now function to connect the complex together. And trust me, it needs connecting - the White House is big. Including below ground levels, the White House is six stories tall, with 132 rooms, 412 doors, 147 windows, 28 fireplaces, 8 staircases, 3 elevators and 35 bathrooms. The grounds contain a tennis court, a basketball court, a putting green, a jogging track, and a swimming pool. They pass an open door, hearing hammering and drilling.
What's in there?
The President's home theater. (smiles) Membership has it's privileges. Cale glances inside, as seven burly SOUNDTEK WORKMEN dril holes into the walls of the theater...
Another part of the building. PRESIDENT SAWYER sweeps dow the hallway, the Chief of Staff and Bishop at his side. Walking through an open door into  25.
The PRESIDENT'S ASSISTANTS sit at three desks and the doo to the Oval proper is guarded by a DRESS MARINE holding a 16. To the Marine:
Morning, Kenny.
Morning, sir.
The New York Times called my treaty a boondoggle this morning. You read the New York Times, Kenny?
I'm more of a Daily News man, sir.

Bill, we need to talk to the Secretary of the Navy about getting Kenny a raise. Margaret, can you get me the Speaker of the House please? I sense a lecture in my future... As the President steps into the Oval Office itself...
Cale, Emily, and the rest of the tour exit the Colonnade into the Visitor's Foyer as Donnie continues.

Besides being a national landmark, the White House also happens to be a technological marvel. Underneath the West Wing is the Situation Room, the most sophisticated military command center in the history of warfare. And underneath the East Wing is the PEOC or Presidential Emergency Operations Center, the single most secure room on the planet. It's a vault built behind ten feet of concrete and steel capable of surviving a thermonuclear blast and equipped so the President and his staff could run the country from inside for six months without leaving.
So where's the bowling alley?
(completely serious) Next to the Vault.
Finnerty, leaving the complex on foot. The kindly old Gat Guard smiles at her as she goes.
See you tomorrow, Carol! Finnerty turns west onto Pennsylvania Avenue...
A long hallway with dramatically vaulted arched ceilings that runs length of the Residence Building.

We're now entering the Center Hall of the Residence. The President and First Lady live on the second and third floors, the Ground Floor and State Floor are dedicated to public rooms. To your left is the Library and to your right is the Vermeil Room, which houses the portraits of several of the most prominent First Lady's who have lived here. Pictures are actually permitted, so snap away. Emily goes to take pictures of the Vermeil Room. how happy she is.
Yours?

Nah, I found her sulking around outside, thought if I brought her it'd make me look smart. Cale watches The woman smiles. Cute. Maybe the day isn't a total loss. She sees one of the paintings on the wall. One of a black White House. Donnie comes over.  27.
Watercolor by George Munger. It's to commemorate the burning of the White House by the British in 1814.
The White House burned down?
In the war of 1812. It practically had to be rebuilt from the ground up. A tugging on Cale's arm.
I think I need to avail myself of one of the 35 bathrooms in here.
There's a ladies room upstairs, but I can't take the tour up there for another fifteen minutes.
I'll take her. Where?
I can go by myself, John. I'm nota little girl. Cale looks at her. Sighs. Deciding.
Okay, but don't touch anything, don't wander off, and don't talk to anyone you're not supposed to.
I make no promises. She goes. Cale steps into the Vermeil Room to look around
The Speaker's ASSISTANT pokes her head in.
Mr. Speaker, I have the President calling for you. Raphelson snatches up his phone.  28.
Mr. President! I'm impressed with all your treaty signings you find time for little old me! INTERCUT with the Oval Office:
You do Jewish Mother's guilt very well, Eli.
I just find it interesting that you would announce the signing of a major treaty with a sworn enemy of our country before, you know, mentioning it to anyone in Congress.
It's the right thing to do, Eli. We're never gonna get a better chance at progress with Iran than right now.
Which would be wonderful if I didn't just have to take your word for it... We PAN out of the office and into the hall...
...Where we pick up the FIDGETY GUY from earlier walking past. Moving with purpose. On his way to

The corridor opens into the enormous room beneath the fam CAPITOL ROTUNDA. Sunlight streams in. Various STATUES. Lincoln. Martin Luther King. Tourists snap photos. The Fidgety Man stops in front of one particular bronze statue. Looks at the name on the base. George Washington. The Fidgety Man checks his watch. It is 9:17 a.m. The man leans down and begins to untie his shoes. Then he removes them. Places them carefully on the floor. Then hi socks. A GUARD notices. This guy is undressing.  29.
Uh, sir? The Man is now unbuttoning his shirt. Muttering to himsel

Sir, you can't do that- The Guard stops. The man has unbuttoned his shirt. He is wearing a VEST OF PLASTIC EXPLOSIVES beneath it. The Guard stares at him, numb. The Fidgety Man raises his hand. Detonator in it. Exhales. Their eyes meet... And then the air is filled with fire.
A muffled WHOOMP! The whole building ROCKS. Raphelson is thrown sideways against his desk, still clutching the pho
Jesus!
(through phone) Eli, are you all right?
I'm fine, I- sir, I think there may have been an explosion here- He opens his door to the outer office - CHAOS. Glass and debris everywhere. Smoke pouring in from the hallway...
Oh, God.
Finnerty hears the explosion before she sees it. Car alar going off. In the distance - Smoke is rising from the Cap Rotunda. Finnerty begins to run towards it...
(into phone) Eli? Bishop getting information from his earpiece:  30.
Mr. President, there's been an explosion at that Capitol, you need to hang up the phone.
What?

(into wrist) We are crashing the White House, repeat, the White House is crashed. Bishop takes the phone from Sawyer and hangs it up as the door opens and THREE AGENTS with SHOTGUNS suddenly come i the room. The DRESS MARINE behind him, wielding his M-16. The Marine bolts the door to the Oval Office as a KLAXON sounds throughout the complex...
Cale looks up at the siren as a SECRET SERVICE AGENT step into the room, blocking the exit.
Everybody please stay where you are. We're briefly restricting movement through the facility, shouldn't be more than a few minutes-
(tries to move past) My daughter's upstairs-
I'm sorry, sir, no one moves until they lift the crash.
I'm an agent on the Speaker's detail-
Then you understand the protocol - nobody moves. Cale stares at him. A couple from Tennessee snaps his picture. This is very exciting.  31.
Raphelson hangs up the phone and looks to his Secret Serv Agent, who's talking on his own phone.
The White House is crashed, sir!
Where's the Vice President?
In his office, I think-
(to his Assistant) Get him on the phone, tell him he needs to institute Continuity of Government-
What 's-
In the event of an attack, all principals in the line of succession are moved to Secondary Locations and a new communications band is put online-
